results.adx_keywords: Search and Seizure;Classified Information and State Secrets;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;Justice Department;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla)
results.title: Republicans, Once Outraged by Mar-a-Lago Search, Become Quieter as Details Emerge
results.abstract: Some of former President Donald J. Trump’s most loyal allies were initially focused elsewhere — a potentially telling reaction with ramifications for his political future.

media.caption: From left, Eric Trump, Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia, Tucker Carlson, Donald Trump Jr. and former President Donald J. Trump at his golf club in Bedminster, N.J., last month. The former president’s allies have been largely silent after the release of the affidavit.
media.copyright: Doug Mills/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Espionage and Intelligence Services;Search and Seizure;Archives and Records;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Garland, Merrick B;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);National Archives and Records Administration;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department
results.title: We Knew the Justice Department Case Was Righteous. This Affidavit Confirms It.
results.abstract: The government doesn’t get to pick and choose which documents to defend based on politics.

media.caption: Donald Trump at his golf course in Bedminster, N.J., in July.
media.copyright: Doug Mills/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Water;Skeletons;DNA (Deoxyribonucleic Acid);Global Warming;Forensic Science;Boats and Boating;Lake Mead
results.title: Authorities Identify Remains Found at Lake Mead
results.abstract: Two decades ago, a man vanished in the water in front of his children. This week, their DNA samples helped to identify his remains, among several discovered recently amid a drought.

media.caption: A decomposing barrel along the shores of Lake Mead, near the spot where a victim who appeared to die from a gunshot wound was discovered in another barrel.
media.copyright: Joe Buglewicz for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Student Loans;Computers and the Internet;Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (2020);Social Media;Taxation;Republican Party;Twitter
results.title: White House Snaps Back at Twitter Critics of Student Loan Relief
results.abstract: In an aggressive turn, the normally staid @WhiteHouse account itemized hundreds of thousands of dollars in pandemic-related debt relief given to U.S. House members who criticized the Biden plan.
des_facet: Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (2020)

media.caption: The White House Twitter account called out Republican members of Congress who tweeted criticism of President Biden’s student loan, noting that several had received government debt relief themselves.
media.copyright: Stefani Reynolds for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Education (K-12);School Boards;School Shootings and Armed Attacks;Parkland, Fla, Shooting (2018);DeSantis, Ron;Broward County (Fla);Florida
results.title: DeSantis Suspends 4 Elected School Board Members After Report on Parkland
results.abstract: A grand jury report found the board members had engaged in “acts of incompetence and neglect of duty,” but an ousted member called the governor’s move “political retribution.”

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis’s decision to suspend four Broward County school board members was not unexpected because of a grand jury recommendation.
media.copyright: Luis Santana/Tampa Bay Times, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Palestinians;Arabs;Jews and Judaism;Social Media;Content Type: Personal Profile;International Relations;Discrimination;Yassin, Nuseir;Israel;Dubai (United Arab Emirates);United Arab Emirates
results.title: ‌A Social Media Star of a Changed Middle East: An Arab From Israel in Dubai
results.abstract: Nuseir Yassin, a Palestinian citizen of Israel with nearly 60 million followers, has taken advantage of new diplomatic ties to move to the United Arab Emirates — angering many Palestinians.

media.caption: Nuseir Yassin, a Palestinian born and raised in Israel, was one of the first Israeli passport holders to take advantage of new diplomatic relations between Israel and the United Arab Emirates.
media.copyright: Andrea DiCenzo for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Therapy and Rehabilitation;Depression (Mental);Anxiety and Stress;Emotions;Teenagers and Adolescence;Suicides and Suicide Attempts;Mental Health and Disorders;Psychology and Psychologists;Content Type: Service;Parenting;your-feed-health;American Academy of Pediatrics
results.title: ‘The Best Tool We Have’ for Self-Harming and Suicidal Teens
results.abstract: Studies indicate that dialectical behavior therapy offers greater benefits than more generalized therapy. But treatment is intensive, and expensive.

media.caption: “There’s no medication for suicidal behavior,” said Michele Berk, a psychologist at Stanford University. “The patient needs to learn other behavioral skills that the medication does not teach you.”
media.copyright: Anastasiia Sapon for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Archives and Records;Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates;Search and Seizure;Sarbanes-Oxley Act;Trump, Donald J;Justice Department;Trump Organization;National Archives and Records Administration;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Federal Bureau of Investigation
results.title: Possibility of Obstruction Looms Over Trump After Thwarted Efforts to Recover Documents
results.abstract: Unredacted portions of the affidavit underlying the Mar-a-Lago search warrant point to a crime that has been overshadowed amid disputes over classified information.
des_facet: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

media.caption: The redacted affidavit, released on Friday by the Justice Department, includes references to possible obstruction.
media.copyright: Jon Elswick/Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Governors;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Politics and Government;Mastriano, Doug;Army War College;Pennsylvania;Confederate States of America
results.title: Doug Mastriano Wore a Confederate Uniform in a Faculty Photo
results.abstract: Mr. Mastriano, the Republican nominee for governor of Pennsylvania, is a state senator whose district includes Gettysburg.

media.caption: Doug Mastriano, left, in a Confederate-style uniform in an Army War College photo from 2014. Mr. Mastriano is running for governor of Pennsylvania.
media.copyright: U.S. Army, via Reuters

results.adx_keywords: Defense and Military Forces;United States Defense and Military Forces;United States International Relations;Drones (Pilotless Planes);Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps;Syria;Iran;Deir al-Zour (Syria)
results.byline: By Farnaz Fassihi, Raja Abdulrahim and Adam Entous
results.title: Fighting Between U.S. and Iran-Backed Militias Escalates in Syria
results.abstract: Two strikes on U.S. military sites have been tied to forces aligned with Iran, raising tensions just as Washington appears close to striking a new nuclear deal with Tehran.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: American forces patrolling in Syria’s northeastern Hasakeh Province in May.
media.copyright: Delil Souleiman/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Global Warming;Greenhouse Gas Emissions;Hazardous and Toxic Substances;PFAS (Per- and Polyfluoroalkyl Substances);Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Water Pollution;Environmental Protection Agency
results.title: E.P.A. to Designate PFAS, or ‘Forever Chemicals,’ as Hazardous
results.abstract: A proposed rule would require companies to report spills of two toxic chemicals that have been linked to cancer.

media.caption: PFAS chemicals have been found in a range of products including carpets, waterproof clothing and food packaging, including some microwave popcorn bags.
media.copyright: Alamy

results.adx_keywords: Firearms;Sales and Excise Taxes;Hunting and Trapping;Law and Legislation;Land Use Policies;Conservation of Resources;United States
results.title: The Sale of a Product Responsible for Bloodshed and Fear Is Still Tied to Our Wildlife
results.abstract: Hunters are a small slice of gun buyers these days. But they benefit from a windfall from a tax on guns.

media.copyright: H. Armstrong Roberts/ClassicStock, via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Television;News and News Media;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Libel and Slander;Compensation for Damages (Law);Presidential Election of 2020;Rumors and Misinformation;Conspiracy Theories;First Amendment (US Constitution);Carlson, Tucker;Dobbs, Lou;Hannity, Sean;Murdoch, Lachlan;Fox News Channel
results.title: Sean Hannity and Other Fox Stars Face Depositions in Defamation Suit
results.abstract: The depositions are one of the clearest indications yet of how aggressively Dominion Voting Systems is moving forward with its suit against the media company.

media.caption: Sean Hannity is the latest Fox News star to be called for a deposition by Dominion Voting Systems’ legal team.
media.copyright: Emil Lippe for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Espionage and Intelligence Services;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Central Intelligence Agency;National Security Agency
results.byline: By Julian E. Barnes and Mark Mazzetti
results.title: Classified Material on Human Intelligence Sources Helped Trigger Alarm
results.abstract: Documents related to the work of clandestine sources are some of the most sensitive and protected in the government. F.B.I. agents found some in boxes retrieved from Donald J. Trump’s home.

media.caption: Information from clandestine sources was included in some of the classified documents removed in January from Mar-a-Lago, former President Donald J. Trump’s home in Florida.
media.copyright: Josh Ritchie for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Corporal Punishment;School Discipline (Students);Education (K-12);Children and Childhood;Black People;Missouri;Southern States (US);Cassville (Mo.)
results.title: Paddling Makes a Comeback in a Missouri School District
results.abstract: Corporal punishment had been in a slow decline before the pandemic, but remains legal in 19 states, mostly in the South. The practice makes children more aggressive and disruptive, researchers say.

media.caption: Corporal punishment remains legal in 19 states despite efforts to abolish it.
media.copyright: Pete Kiehart for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Islands;Rescues;Traffic Accidents and Safety;Maritime Accidents and Safety;Automobiles;Christians and Christianity;Holy Island (England);England
results.byline: By Stephen Castle and Andrew Testa
results.title: A Holy British Island, Where the Reckless Try to Outrace the Tide
results.abstract: As the cradle of Christianity in northern England, the isle of Lindisfarne attracts 650,000 visitors a year, some of whom ignore the warning signs of when it’s safe to cross a causeway that twice a day is submerged.

media.caption: High tide beginning to cover the causeway to Holy Island.
media.copyright: Andrew Testa for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Marriages;Love (Emotion);Dating and Relationships;Chapman, Gary (1938- )
results.byline: By Alisha Haridasani Gupta and Luis Mazon
results.title: The Sixth Love Language Does Not Exist
results.abstract: The author of the seminal book on love languages is surprised that the concept has become a cultural phenomenon. But he still wants couples to heed his advice.

media.caption: Karolyn and Gary Chapman at their wedding reception in August 1961. The couple, who have been married for over 60 years, said they had a rocky start.
media.copyright: via Dr. Gary Chapman

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Sex Crimes;Legal Profession;Child Abuse and Neglect;Human Trafficking;Prostitution;Borgerson, Scott;Epstein, Jeffrey E (1953- );Maxwell, Ghislaine;Haddon, Morgan and Foreman PC
results.title: Ghislaine Maxwell’s Own Lawyers Are Now Suing Her
results.abstract: The law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman has accused Ms. Maxwell and her brother of failing to pay nearly $900,000 in legal fees related to her sex abuse defense.

media.caption: Ghislaine Maxwell and her brother, Kevin Maxwell, grew up amid wealth, but her lawyers say they quit paying their legal bills last year.
media.copyright: Sylvain Gaboury/Patrick McMullan, via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Dietary Supplements and Herbal Remedies;Deaths (Fatalities);McClintock, Lori (d 2021);McClintock, Thomas M (1956- );Food and Drug Administration
results.title: Death of Rep. Tom McClintock’s Wife Tied to White Mulberry Leaf
results.abstract: The Sacramento County Coroner’s Office said Lori McClintock died in December 2021 of dehydration caused by stomach inflammation from consuming the herbal remedy.

media.caption: Lori McClintock with her husband, Tom, in 2003, when he was running for governor of California. She died in December.
media.copyright: AP Photo/Nick Ut

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Admissions Standards;Affirmative Action;Race and Ethnicity;Discrimination;Minorities;Black People;University of Michigan;University of California;Harvard University;University of North Carolina;Supreme Court (US)
results.title: Affirmative Action Was Banned at Two Top Universities. They Say They Need It.
results.abstract: As a Supreme Court case on college admissions nears, the California and Michigan university systems say their efforts to build diverse classes have hardly worked.

media.caption: The University of Michigan stated that despite “persistent, vigorous and varied efforts” to diversify its student body, the enrollment of underrepresented minority students has “fallen precipitously” at many of its schools.
media.copyright: Joshua Lott for The New York Times
